quest.name: A Way Forward
journal: Alphinaud's resolve may be shaken, but he has not forgotten his duty.

The tragedy that unfolded on the Eblan Rime has clearly left its mark on Alphinaud and Alisaie. Your hearts heavy with guilt and sorrow, you return to Camp Broken Glass to relay these unfortunate events.

Lucia and the others are shocked to hear the outcome of your first encounter with Garlean locals. Making a conscious effort not to dwell on the matter, the conversation turns to the collapse of the Empire. You come to the realization that some few were spared from being tempered by devices known as radios, which, perhaps more by coincidence than design, possess similar properties to the warding scales. The discussion is interrupted by the discovery of an intruder in the camp─a young Garlean soldier named Jullus who was caught stealing provisions. Despite his initial hostility, he is eventually persuaded to take you, Alisaie, and Alphinaud to parley with his commander.

Lucia offers a few parting words, including cryptic comments to observe proper social etiquette, and that Thancred will be worried for your well-being. As Jullus is within earshot, you can only surmise it is a not-so-subtle reminder to take no action against the soldiers regardless of the circumstances─you are to observe their disposition only; and should you come to be in need of assistance, a concealed Thancred will likely be nearby to offer it. You ponder this possibility as you prepare for a journey across the snowy plains.

Jullus decides to wait until your party is outside of Camp Broken Glass before revealing even the slightest hint as to where you are heading, for fear your allies might surmise the location of his base of operations. For the time being, you comply with his wishes and follow him until you are all out of earshot.

Jullus explains the route you must take in order to approach his faction's headquarters. As he is still extremely wary around you and the twins, he forbids you from drawing your weapons in his presence. In order to keep an eye on them, Jullus instructs Alphinaud and Alisaie to take the lead, while you join him in bringing up the rear.

※If you part ways with Jullus or fall behind Alphinaud and Alisaie, return to the starting point and speak with Jullus to try again.

You manage to evade the local wildlife and finally reach Liminal Station IV. The sense of accomplishment is fleeting, however, as Jullus then reveals that this location is nothing more than a brief stop for him to ensure that none of your comrades are attempting to follow in violation of the agreement. Satisfied you are alone, he bids you continue along to your true destination.

The next part of your journey will take you near the remains of a sprawling residential district. With hordes of tempered soldiers and civilians prowling the streets, your party will need to move swiftly to sneak past without incident.
objectives: Speak with Jullus again to accompany him.
Speak with Jullus, then follow Alphinaud and Alisaie.

dialogue.name: ALISAIE
dialogue.text: If only we'd had a chance to talk things over...but it's too late now. Too late by far.

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: We have already caused enough harm here. Let us return to the camp before we cause any more.

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: As for those inside the house, we should send someone to take care of them. Someone who isn't us.

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: All we can do for now is make our report to Lucia...and do everything in our power to prevent further tragedy.

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: So let us linger here no more. Come...

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: Would you mind giving Lucia a full report?

dialogue.name: ALISAIE
dialogue.text: We mustn't forget to send some of our allies to Tapper's Den. We still owe them for the bottle of ceruleum.

dialogue.name: YSHTOLA
dialogue.text: Treatment of the tempered is proceeding as well as can be expected. If there is anything to report, you will be sure to know, though I gather you have a report of your own to deliver...

dialogue.name: ARUHNSENNA
dialogue.text: Is something the matter? The twins look out of sorts, and you too seem a bit...off.

dialogue.name: MAXIMA
dialogue.text: Forgive me for saying, but the three of you appear rather drained since your return. Is there aught I might do to be of assistance?

dialogue.name: LUCIA
dialogue.text: Alisaie and Alphinaud tell me they have finished their preliminary search for survivors, but refrained from saying much more than that.

dialogue.name: LUCIA
dialogue.text: Clearly they are reluctant to provide details. Might I ask for your account?

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: Perhaps it is unwise to volunteer for a mission so soon after the previous disaster... Nevertheless, I shall not squander this opportunity.

dialogue.name: ALISAIE
dialogue.text: I know, I know. This won't bring back Licinia or her sister.

dialogue.name: ALISAIE
dialogue.text: Taking the same risks, making the same mistakes... It's possible, but better to try than to give up. Every time.

dialogue.name: YSHTOLA
dialogue.text: I worry they were not in the best state of mind to volunteer for this undertaking, but what's done is done. I know you will take good care of them─and yourself as well, I trust.

dialogue.name: ARUHNSENNA
dialogue.text: They are...resilient in the face of hardship. You as well.

dialogue.name: ARUHNSENNA
dialogue.text: But good intentions and stubborn determination alone will not be enough to bring our mission to a successful conclusion. Be on your guard.

dialogue.name: MAXIMA
dialogue.text: Jullus pyr Norbanus... It is unusual for one so young to achieve such a high rank. Very unusual.

dialogue.name: MAXIMA
dialogue.text: His uniform identifies him as a member of the Ist Legion, which has a particularly fierce reputation. Whoever his superior may be, I advise you to approach them with caution.

dialogue.name: CIRINA
dialogue.text: We captured the boy as he was about to make off with our food. He must be very hungry to take such risks.

dialogue.name: CIRINA
dialogue.text: Maybe we should give him something to eat. Reward him for his boldness.

dialogue.name: MAGNAI
dialogue.text: The lowly task of keeping watching over provisions would not normally befit the Sun. But these being unusual circumstances, I will let no man take that which is not by rights theirs.

dialogue.name: JULLUS
dialogue.text: Said your farewells, have you?

dialogue.name: LUCIA
dialogue.text: You will be received as invited guests, and so I urge you to observe proper social etiquette and conduct yourselves accordingly.

dialogue.name: LUCIA
dialogue.text: Your safe return takes precedence above all else. Remember this.

dialogue.name: LUCIA
dialogue.text: Thancred in particular will be worried sick if you're gone too long. May the Fury watch over and keep you.

dialogue.name: LUCIA
dialogue.text: As I said before, Thancred can be quite the worrier, but rest assured he only has your best interests at heart...

dialogue.name: JULLUS
dialogue.text: Are you and the children ready?

dialogue.name: JULLUS
dialogue.text: I will explain the route once we are outside your camp.

dialogue.name: JULLUS
dialogue.text: If anyone attempts to follow us, we will judge it an act of hostility. We will not hesitate to take appropriate measures.

dialogue.name: LUCIA
dialogue.text: I would expect nothing less. You have our full cooperation.

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: We will do only as instructed. After all, this is what we have been striving for ever since we arrived.

dialogue.name: ALISAIE
dialogue.text: Where do you think their headquarters are? I assume there are a few others beside him and this commander he mentioned.

dialogue.name: JULLUS
dialogue.text: All right, this is far enough. Listen carefully.

dialogue.name: JULLUS
dialogue.text: We head over that hill, then follow the road until we reach Liminal Station IV.

dialogue.name: JULLUS
dialogue.text: Children in the lead. I want you where I can see you.

dialogue.name: ALISAIE
dialogue.text: We do have names, you know. I'm Alisaie, and he's Alphinaud. And last but not least, there's Forename.

dialogue.name: JULLUS
dialogue.text: Forename... Where have I heard that before...?

dialogue.name: JULLUS
dialogue.text: No matter. “Alphinaud” and “Alisaie” will watch the road ahead, while we bring up the rear.

dialogue.name: JULLUS
dialogue.text: I wasn't lying about there being many dangers, so you're to run─not saunter, run─towards the station. If you even think about going for your weapon, the deal's off. Should any creatures bar the way, we go around them.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: Once you choose to depart, Jullus will accompany you. Alphinaud and Alisaie will then begin moving towards the destination.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: Make your way to Liminal Station IV without falling behind.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: If you leave Jullus behind for any reason, or lose sight of Alphinaud and Alisaie, you may try again by returning to the starting point.

dialogue.name: JULLUS
dialogue.text: Ready to make a dash for the station?

dialogue.name: Q1
dialogue.text: What will you say?

dialogue.name: JULLUS
dialogue.text: Over that hill, then follow the road until we reach the station. So, are you ready?

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: Once you choose to depart, Jullus will accompany you. Alphinaud and Alisaie will then begin moving towards the destination.

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: Whenever you are ready, Forename. Just give the word to Jullus.

dialogue.name: ALISAIE
dialogue.text: What are we waiting for? Let's get this over with.

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: I'm still unsure about leading the way, but we will do our best!

dialogue.name: ALISAIE
dialogue.text: Don't fall behind!

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: It's nothing like the ones in Thanalan...

dialogue.name: ALISAIE
dialogue.text: We're here...I think.

dialogue.name: Q2
dialogue.text: What will you do?

dialogue.name: A2
dialogue.text: Speak with Jullus.

dialogue.name: A2
dialogue.text: Part ways with Jullus.

dialogue.name: A2
dialogue.text: Nothing.

dialogue.name: JULLUS
dialogue.text: If it's conversation you want, save it until we've arrived.

dialogue.name: Q3
dialogue.text: Are you sure you wish to part ways with Jullus?

dialogue.name: JULLUS
dialogue.text: Having second thoughts? Hmph! Very well. Return to and regroup where we started.

dialogue.name: JULLUS
dialogue.text: No shuffling along at a snail's pace to give your comrades a chance to pursue us. You're to run as fast as you can─understood?

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: Jullus will now accompany you. Keep up with Alphinaud and Alisaie and head for your destination.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: Jullus has yet to arrive. Be sure he is at your side before attempting to continue.

dialogue.name: JULLUS
dialogue.text: Can't any of you follow simple instructions?

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: Speak with Alphinaud or Alisaie at Camp Broken Glass to try again.

dialogue.name: JULLUS
dialogue.text: This is it. The first stop, that is.

dialogue.name: JULLUS
dialogue.text: Good. It looks like your friends knew better than to follow us.

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: Are these your headquarters?

dialogue.name: JULLUS
dialogue.text: No. We're stopping here so I can check for pursuers. Since it appears you've kept to your side of the bargain, we can carry on.

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: We're getting closer to the imperial palace...if one can still call it that. It truly is a terrifying sight to behold...

dialogue.name: ALISAIE
dialogue.text: I wonder what sort of conditions Jullus and his comrades are living in. If they've any sense, they'll have picked somewhere like Victors' Spoils to take shelter.

dialogue.name: JULLUS
dialogue.text: North of the station is Regio Domorum, one of the main residential areas. Or at least it was.

dialogue.name: JULLUS
dialogue.text: The afflicted roam the streets in packs. They'll tear us to shreds if given the chance. Keep close─no wandering off. Understood?

obj.n: At the End of the Trail
